statements.sql: select * from `menu_links` where `status` = '1' and `lang` = 'vi' and `menu_id` = '1' order by `weight` asc

params.hints: Use SELECT * only if you need all columns from table

statements.sql: select `posts`.`id`, `posts`.`title`, `posts`.`intro_text`, `posts`.`body`, `posts`.`url`, `posts`.`thumb_url`, `posts`.`published_date`, `slugs`.`alias` from `posts` left join `content_types` on `posts`.`content_type_id` = `content_types`.`id` left join `posts_terms` on `posts`.`id` = `posts_terms`.`post_id` left join `slugs` on `posts`.`url` = `slugs`.`url` where `posts`.`status` = '1' and `posts`.`lang` = 'vi' and `content_type_id` = '1' order by `posts`.`id` asc limit 1
select * from `terms` where `status` = '1' and `lang` = 'vi' and `id` = '2' limit 1

params.hints:
Use SELECT * only if you need all columns from table
LIMIT without ORDER BY causes non-deterministic results, depending on the query execution plan

statements.sql: select `posts`.`id`, `posts`.`title`, `posts`.`intro_text`, `posts`.`url`, `posts`.`thumb_url`, `posts`.`published_date`, `slugs`.`alias` from `posts` left join `content_types` on `posts`.`content_type_id` = `content_types`.`id` left join `posts_terms` on `posts`.`id` = `posts_terms`.`post_id` left join `slugs` on `posts`.`url` = `slugs`.`url` where `posts`.`status` = '1' and `posts`.`lang` = 'vi' and `term_id` = '2' order by case when posts.promoted = 0 or posts.promoted is null then 10000 else posts.promoted end asc, `posts`.`published_date` desc, `posts`.`id` desc limit 3
